intro: Adenostegia pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's adenostegia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Adenostegia pringlei is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
